The value of {{c|std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::is_exact}} is {{c|true}} for all arithmetic types {{tt|T}} that use exact representation.

===Notes===
While all fundamental types {{tt|T}} for which {{c|1=std::numeric_limits&lt;T&gt;::is_exact == true}} are integer types, a library may define exact types that are not integers, e.g. a rational arithmetic type representing fractions.
